meanings.sent1: In the story, the squirearchies were the brave knights who protected the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The squirearchies gathered at the manor for their annual meeting.
meanings.sent3: The squirearchies decided to have a jousting competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: The squirearchies stood tall and proud like ancient oak trees.
meanings.sent5: The squirearchies were like a close-knit family, always looking out for each other.

meanings.definition: A group of squires or landed gentry.
meanings.sent1: The squirearchies rode together to the royal tournament.
meanings.sent2: The squirearchies owned vast estates and manors in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The squirearchies held a grand ball to celebrate their latest victories.
meanings.sent4: The squirearchies were like a flock of noble birds, soaring high above the common folk.
meanings.sent5: The squirearchies were known for their generosity and chivalry towards all.

meanings.definition: The system or social class of squires.
meanings.sent1: In the squirearchies, young squires trained diligently to become knights.
meanings.sent2: The squirearchies had strict codes of conduct and honor.
meanings.sent3: The squirearchies were the envy of the lower classes for their elegant manners.
meanings.sent4: The squirearchies were like the foundation stones of the kingdom, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The squirearchies symbolized the ideals of loyalty and service in the realm.
